properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Brief freezing rain possible late this afternoon into this evening. Brief freezing rain is possible late this afternoon into this evening in areas where temperatures are near or below the freezing mark. Untreated surfaces like sidewalks and driveways are more likely to be icy than busy streets and highways. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-12T00:54:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-11T21:06:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1753032501.2019

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near 5 millimetres of freezing precipitation is expected overnight tonight. The freezing rain will change to rain Friday morning. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-12T00:25:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-11T15:26:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1860050210.2019

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain overnight to Friday morning. Precipitation will begin as snow late this afternoon or this evening, then change to ice pellets. Ice pellets will change to freezing rain overnight. Freezing rain will continue for several hours before finally changing to rain Friday morning. This winter weather is associated with a Colorado Low that will track across Northeastern Ontario Friday. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-12T00:14:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-11T15:15:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0865497889.2019

properties.Title: Update: Flood Watch Continued For All Points Along The Roseau River
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a Flood Watch for all points along the Roseau River due to expected high water flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions given by local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2019-04-12T11:00:00-05:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2019-04-11T10:28:34-05:00, 271D7399-2B28-3E50-89E4-83C4AB835D61
Area: All points along the Roseau River
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant rainfall possible Friday. Freezing rain will change to rain Friday morning before ending late Friday afternoon. There is also a risk of a thunderstorm late tonight and into Friday morning. Significant rainfall amounts of 15 to 25 mm are possible, especially in areas that see a thunderstorm. Local ponding on streets and low lying areas is possible. For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry District Office. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-12T03:17:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-11T19:18:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0609018285.2019
Area: Searchmont - Montreal River Harbour - Batchawana Bay, Sault Ste. Marie - St. Joseph Island, Greater Sudbury and vicinity, Elliot Lake - Ranger Lake, West Nipissing - French River, North Bay - Powassan - Mattawa, Blind River - Thessalon, Espanola - Killarney
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A Winter Weather Travel Advisory is in effect for tonight. Heavy snow mixed with ice pellets at times, is expected tonight across portions of highway 17 between Wawa and Marathon. Local snow and ice pellet amounts of of 10 to 15 cm are possible by Friday morning. Motorists should be prepared for difficult winter driving conditions due to rapidly accumulating snow and low visibilities in heavy snow. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-12T11:41:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-11T19:42:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3436975171.2019
Area: White River - Dubreuilville, Wawa - Pukaskwa Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Update Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued By The Village Of Paynton.
properties.Summary:
Description: UPDATE A precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Village of Paynton. This advisory is for the entire community and for individuals who may have access water from the Village of Paynton water system. This advisory has been extended and will remain in effect until April 12, 2019.

properties.Title: Update: Flood Warning Continued For The Red River From Emerson To The Red River Floodway Channel Inlet
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a Flood Warning on the Red River from Emerson to the Red River Floodway channel inlet due to high water flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions given by local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca or stay tuned to local media.

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall likely this evening into Friday. Snow, heavy at times, will begin over Northern Ontario this evening and continue Friday. Total snowfall accumulations of 10 to 15 cm are possible by late Friday. Strong easterly winds with gusts to 60 km/h will also generate occasional blowing snow giving reduced visibilities. The snow may become mixed with freezing drizzle at times, especially for areas close to Lake Superior. At this point, it appears that the heaviest snowfall associated with this Colorado Low will remain south of the international border where Winter Storm Warnings are in effect. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-12T02:58:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-11T18:59:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4208740154.2019
Area: Seine River Village - Mine Centre, City of Thunder Bay, Beardmore - Jellicoe - Macdiarmid, Gull Bay - Black Sturgeon Lake, Nakina - Aroland - Pagwa, Geraldton - Longlac - Caramat, Upsala - Raith, Atikokan - Shebandowan - Quetico Park, Cloud Bay - Dorion, Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake, Nipigon - Rossport
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow beginning this evening changing to ice pellets overnight and to freezing rain Friday morning. Precipitation will move over Northern Ontario this evening. The precipitation will begin as snow heavy at times before changing to ice pellets overnight then to freezing rain Friday morning. Snow and ice pellet amounts are forecast to be in a range from 5 to 15 cm by Friday morning. Current indications suggest that a swath from Pukaskwa National Park to southwest of Hearst is most likely to receive the heaviest snow and ice pellet amounts. The precipitation is forecast to change to freezing rain Friday morning and may last for several hours before changing to rain Friday afternoon. Freezing rain warnings may be required. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-12T03:42:40-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-11T19:43:40-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2199724086.2019
Area: Manitouwadge - Hornepayne, Marathon - Schreiber, Fraserdale - Pledger Lake, Kapuskasing - Hearst - Smooth Rock Falls, Little Abitibi - Kesagami Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant rainfall is possible tonight into Friday with a risk of freezing rain late tonight. Rain will begin tonight and continue into Friday. There is a risk of freezing rain overnight as temperatures will be near the freezing mark. By Friday morning, temperatures will rise well above zero bringing the risk of freezing rain to an end. There is also a risk of a thunderstorm overnight into Friday morning. Significant rainfall amounts of 15 to 25 mm are possible by Friday afternoon, especially in areas that see a thunderstorm. Local ponding on streets and low lying areas is possible. For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry District Office. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-12T02:57:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-11T18:58:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0887255422.2019
Area: Manitoulin Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Light snow and blowing snow will continue this evening. Conditions will begin to improve near midnight as the snow tapers off and winds diminish gradually. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-12T02:00:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-11T18:45:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2747853607.2019
Area: Postville - Makkovik
properties.Author: Environment Canada
